gov.nasa.arc.mct.gui.util
Class ConstraintBuilder

java.lang.Object
  gov.nasa.arc.mct.gui.util.ConstraintBuilder

public class ConstraintBuilder
extends java.lang.Object

Implements a builder pattern for creating layout constraints for the GridBagLayout layout manager.

Field Summary
static int DEFAULT_HPAD
          The default amount of horizontal padding to add to cells.
 
Constructor Summary
ConstraintBuilder(java.awt.Container container)
          Creates a new builder with default constraints.
 
Method Summary
 void add(java.awt.Component... components)
          Finishes constraint building and adds a sequence of components to the container using the resulting constraints.
 void add(java.awt.Component component)
          Finishes constraint building and adds a component to the container using the resulting constraints.
 ConstraintBuilder at(int row, int column)
          Sets the grid position of a component.
 ConstraintBuilder baseline_centered()
          Sets the anchor position so that the component will be centered in its cell, with its baseline aligned with the baselines of other components in the same row.
 ConstraintBuilder baseline_e()
          Sets the anchor position so that the component will be right-aligned in its cell, with its baseline aligned with the baselines of other components in the same row.
 ConstraintBuilder baseline_w()
          Sets the anchor position so that the component will be left-aligned in its cell, with its baseline aligned with the baselines of other components in the same row.

          Gets a rigid, zero-height component of a desired width, to aid spacing apart adjacent components.
static java.awt.Component hbox(int minWidth, int preferredWidth, int maxWidth)
          Returns a stretchable, zero-height component of desired minimum, preferred, and maximum width, to aid in spacing apart adjacent components.
 ConstraintBuilder hfill()
          Sets the constraints so that the component will be sized to fill its cell horizontally, if there is extra horizontal room in the cell.
 ConstraintBuilder hpad(int padding)
          Sets the horizontal padding for the component.
 ConstraintBuilder hvfill()
          Sets the constraints so that the component will be sized to fill its cell both horizontally and vertically, if there is extra room in the cell.
 ConstraintBuilder insets(int top, int left, int bottom, int right)
          Sets the inset widths for the cell containing the component to add.
 ConstraintBuilder makeDefault()
          Sets the current constraints to be the defaults.
 ConstraintBuilder nextColumn()
          Moves to the next column in the grid.
 ConstraintBuilder nextRow()
          Moves to the next row down, in the first column.
 ConstraintBuilder nw()
          Sets the anchor position so that the component will be in the northwest corner of its cell.
 ConstraintBuilder reset()
          Resets all constraints to the default values, and set up for creating a single grid cell.
 ConstraintBuilder span(int nRows, int nColumns)
          Sets the grid span of a component.
 ConstraintBuilder sw()
          Sets the anchor position so that the component will be in the southwest corner of its cell.
 ConstraintBuilder vfill()
          Sets the constraints so that the component will be sized to fill its cell vertically, if there is extra vertical room in the cell.
 ConstraintBuilder vpad(int padding)
          Sets the vertical padding for the component.
 ConstraintBuilder w()
          Sets the anchor position so that the component will be centered vertically within its cell, at the west edge.
 ConstraintBuilder weight(float weightx, float weighty)
          Sets the stretch weights so the component will take some of the extra space allowed for the container, if any.

weight

public ConstraintBuilder weight(float weightx,
                                float weighty)
Sets the stretch weights so the component will take some of the extra space allowed for the container, if any. If the weights are set to 0.0, then the component's cell will not expand.

Parameters:
weightx - the horizontal stretch weight
weighty - the vertical stretch weight
Returns:
the builder

add

public void add(java.awt.Component component)
Finishes constraint building and adds a component to the container using the resulting constraints. Also resets the span to 1x1 and the fill to none for the next constraints constructed.

Parameters:
component - the component to add

nextRow

public ConstraintBuilder nextRow()
Moves to the next row down, in the first column.

Returns:
the builder

nextColumn

public ConstraintBuilder nextColumn()
Moves to the next column in the grid.

Returns:
the builder

add

public void add(java.awt.Component... components)
Finishes constraint building and adds a sequence of components to the container using the resulting constraints. Also resets the span to 1x1 and the fill to none for the next constraints constructed. The sequence of components is laid out in a subpanel using a flow layout to get left-to-right rendering

Parameters:
components - the component to add

hbox

public static java.awt.Component hbox(int width)
Gets a rigid, zero-height component of a desired width, to aid spacing apart adjacent components.

Parameters:
width - the width of the new component
Returns:
the rigid spacing component

hbox

public static java.awt.Component hbox(int minWidth,
                                      int preferredWidth,
                                      int maxWidth)
Returns a stretchable, zero-height component of desired minimum, preferred, and maximum width, to aid in spacing apart adjacent components. If all three widths are equal, then the spacer will be of rigid width.

Parameters:
minWidth - the minimum width of the spacer component
preferredWidth - the preferred width of the spacer component
maxWidth - the maximum width of the spacer comopnent
Returns:
the stretchable spacer component
